013package org.apache.juneau.xml;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.util.*;
020
021import javax.xml.stream.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.*;
026
027/**
028 * XML utility methods.
029 *
030 * <ul class='seealso'>
031 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.XmlDetails">XML Details</a>
032
033 * </ul>
034 */
035public final class XmlUtils {
036
037   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
038   // XML element names
039   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
040
041   /**
042    * Encodes any invalid XML element name characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences.
043    *
044    * @param w The writer to send the output to.
045    * @param value The object being encoded.
046    * @return The same writer passed in.
047    */
048   public static final Writer encodeElementName(Writer w, Object value) {
049      try {
050         if (value == null)
051            return w.append("_x0000_");
052         String s = value.toString();
053         if (needsElementNameEncoding(s))
054            return encodeElementNameInner(w, s);
055         w.append(s);
056      } catch (IOException e) {
057         throw asRuntimeException(e);
058      }
059      return w;
060   }
061
062   /**
063    * Encodes any invalid XML element name characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences.
064    *
065    * @param value The object being encoded.
066    * @return The encoded element name string.
067    */
068   public static final String encodeElementName(Object value) {
069      if (value == null)
070         return "_x0000_";
071      String s = value.toString();
072      if (s.isEmpty())
073         return "_xE000_";
074
075      try {
076         if (needsElementNameEncoding(s))
077            try (Writer w = new StringBuilderWriter(s.length() * 2)) {
078               return encodeElementNameInner(w, s).toString();
079            }
080      } catch (IOException e) {
081         throw asRuntimeException(e); // Never happens
082      }
083
084      return s;
085   }
086
087   private static final Writer encodeElementNameInner(Writer w, String s) throws IOException {
088      for (int i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
089         char c = s.charAt(i);
090         if ((c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')
091               || (c == '_' && ! isEscapeSequence(s,i))
092               || (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
093               || (i != 0 && (
094                     c == '-'
095                     || c == '.'
096                     || (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
097                     || c == '\u00b7'
098                     || (c >= '\u0300' && c <= '\u036f')
099                     || (c >= '\u203f' && c <= '\u2040')
100                  ))
101               || (c >= '\u00c0' && c <= '\u00d6')
102               || (c >= '\u00d8' && c <= '\u00f6')
103               || (c >= '\u00f8' && c <= '\u02ff')
104               || (c >= '\u0370' && c <= '\u037d')
105               || (c >= '\u037f' && c <= '\u1fff')
106               || (c >= '\u200c' && c <= '\u200d')
107               || (c >= '\u2070' && c <= '\u218f')
108               || (c >= '\u2c00' && c <= '\u2fef')
109               || (c >= '\u3001' && c <= '\ud7ff')
110               || (c >= '\uf900' && c <= '\ufdcf')
111               || (c >= '\ufdf0' && c <= '\ufffd')) {
112            w.append(c);
113         }  else {
114            appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
115         }
116      }
117      return w;
118   }
119
120   private static final boolean needsElementNameEncoding(String value) {
121      // Note that this doesn't need to be perfect, just fast.
122      for (int i = 0; i < value.length(); i++) {
123         char c = value.charAt(i);
124         if (! (c >= '0' && c <= '9' || c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' || c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z') || (i == 0 && (c >= '0' && c <= '9')))
125            return true;
126      }
127      return false;
128   }
129
130   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
131   // XML element text
132   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
133
134   /**
135    * Escapes invalid XML text characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences.
136    *
137    * @param value The object being encoded.
138    * @return The encoded string.
139    */
140   public static final String escapeText(Object value) {
141      if (value == null)
142         return "_x0000_";
143      String s = value.toString();
144
145      try {
146         if (! needsTextEncoding(s))
147            return s;
148         final int len = s.length();
149         StringWriter sw = new StringWriter(s.length()*2);
150         for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
151            char c = s.charAt(i);
152            if ((i == 0 || i == len-1) && Character.isWhitespace(c))
153               appendPaddedHexChar(sw, c);
154            else if (c == '_' && isEscapeSequence(s,i))
155               appendPaddedHexChar(sw, c);
156            else if (isValidXmlCharacter(c))
157               sw.append(c);
158            else
159               appendPaddedHexChar(sw, c);
160         }
161         return sw.toString();
162      } catch (IOException e) {
163         throw asRuntimeException(e); // Never happens
164      }
165   }
166
167   /**
168    * Encodes the specified element text and sends the results to the specified writer.
169    *
170    * <p>
171    * Encodes any invalid XML text characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences and sends the response to the specified
172    * writer.
173    * <br>Encodes <js>'&amp;'</js>, <js>'&lt;'</js>, and <js>'&gt;'</js> as XML entities.
174    * <br>Encodes invalid XML text characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences.
175    *
176    * @param w The writer to send the output to.
177    * @param value The object being encoded.
178    * @param trim Trim the text before serializing it.
179    * @param preserveWhitespace
180    *    Specifies whether we're in preserve-whitespace mode.
181    *    (e.g. {@link XmlFormat#MIXED_PWS} or {@link XmlFormat#TEXT_PWS}.
182    *    If <jk>true</jk>, leading and trailing whitespace characters will be encoded.
183    * @return The same writer passed in.
184    */
185   public static final Writer encodeText(Writer w, Object value, boolean trim, boolean preserveWhitespace) {
186
187      try {
188         if (value == null)
189            return w.append("_x0000_");
190         String s = value.toString();
191         if (s.isEmpty())
192            return w.append("_xE000_");
193         if (trim)
194            s = s.trim();
195
196         if (needsTextEncoding(s)) {
197            final int len = s.length();
198            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
199               char c = s.charAt(i);
200               if ((i == 0 || i == len-1) && Character.isWhitespace(c) && ! preserveWhitespace)
201                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
202               else if (REPLACE_TEXT.contains(c))
203                  w.append(REPLACE_TEXT.get(c));
204               else if (c == '_' && isEscapeSequence(s,i))
205                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
206               else if (isValidXmlCharacter(c))
207                  w.append(c);
208               else
209                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
210            }
211         } else {
212            w.append(s);
213         }
214      } catch (IOException e) {
215         throw asRuntimeException(e);
216      }
217
218      return w;
219   }
220
221   private static final boolean needsTextEncoding(String value) {
222      // See if we need to convert the string.
223      // Conversion is somewhat expensive, so make sure we need to do so before hand.
224      final int len = value.length();
225      for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
226         char c = value.charAt(i);
227         if ((i == 0 || i == len-1) && Character.isWhitespace(c))
228            return true;
229         if (REPLACE_TEXT.contains(c) || ! isValidXmlCharacter(c) || (c == '_' && isEscapeSequence(value,i)))
230            return true;
231      }
232      return false;
233   }
234
235   private static AsciiMap REPLACE_TEXT = new AsciiMap()
236      .append('&', "&amp;")
237      .append('<', "&lt;")
238      .append('>', "&gt;")
239      .append((char)0x09, "&#x0009;")
240      .append((char)0x0A, "&#x000a;")
241      .append((char)0x0D, "&#x000d;");
242
243
244   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
245   // XML attribute names
246   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
247
248   /**
249    * Serializes and encodes the specified object as valid XML attribute name.
250    *
251    * @param w The writer to send the output to.
252    * @param value The object being serialized.
253    * @return This object.
254    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred.
255    */
256   public static final Writer encodeAttrName(Writer w, Object value) throws IOException {
257      if (value == null)
258         return w.append("_x0000_");
259      String s = value.toString();
260
261      if (needsAttrNameEncoding(s)) {
262         for (int i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
263            char c = s.charAt(i);
264            if (i == 0) {
265               if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' || c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z' || c == ':')
266                  w.append(c);
267               else if (c == '_' && ! isEscapeSequence(s,i))
268                  w.append(c);
269               else
270                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
271            } else {
272               if ((c >= '0' && c <= '9' || c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' || c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z' || c == ':'))
273                  w.append(c);
274               else if (c == '_' && ! isEscapeSequence(s,i))
275                  w.append(c);
276               else
277                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
278            }
279         }
280      } else {
281         w.append(s);
282      }
283
284      return w;
285   }
286
287   private static final boolean needsAttrNameEncoding(String value) {
288      // Note that this doesn't need to be perfect, just fast.
289      for (int i = 0; i < value.length(); i++) {
290         char c = value.charAt(i);
291         if (! (c >= '0' && c <= '9' || c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' || c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z') || (i == 0 && ! (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' || c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')))
292            return true;
293      }
294      return false;
295   }
296
297   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
298   // XML attribute values
299   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
300
301   /**
302    * Encodes the specified attribute value and sends the results to the specified writer.
303    *
304    * <p>
305    * Encodes any invalid XML text characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences and sends the response to the specified
306    * writer.
307    * <br>Encodes <js>'&amp;'</js>, <js>'&lt;'</js>, <js>'&gt;'</js>, <js>'"'</js>, and <js>'\''</js> as XML entities.
308    * <br>Encodes invalid XML text characters to <c>_x####_</c> sequences.
309    *
310    * @param w The writer to send the output to.
311    * @param value The object being encoded.
312    * @param trim
313    *    Trim the text before serializing it.
314    *    If <jk>true</jk>, leading and trailing whitespace characters will be encoded.
315    * @return The same writer passed in.
316    */
317   public static final Writer encodeAttrValue(Writer w, Object value, boolean trim) {
318      try {
319         if (value == null)
320            return w.append("_x0000_");
321         String s = value.toString();
322         if (s.isEmpty())
323            return w;
324         if (trim)
325            s = s.trim();
326
327         if (needsAttrValueEncoding(s)) {
328            final int len = s.length();
329            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
330               char c = s.charAt(i);
331               if ((i == 0 || i == len-1) && Character.isWhitespace(c))
332                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
333               else if (REPLACE_ATTR_VAL.contains(c))
334                  w.append(REPLACE_ATTR_VAL.get(c));
335               else if (c == '_' && isEscapeSequence(s,i))
336                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
337               else if (isValidXmlCharacter(c))
338                  w.append(c);
339               else
340                  appendPaddedHexChar(w, c);
341            }
342         } else {
343            w.append(s);
344         }
345      } catch (IOException e) {
346         throw asRuntimeException(e);
347      }
348
349      return w;
350   }
351
352   private static final boolean needsAttrValueEncoding(String value) {
353      // See if we need to convert the string.
354      // Conversion is somewhat expensive, so make sure we need to do so before hand.
355      final int len = value.length();
356      for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
357         char c = value.charAt(i);
358         if ((i == 0 || i == len-1) && Character.isWhitespace(c))
359            return true;
360         if (REPLACE_ATTR_VAL.contains(c) || ! isValidXmlCharacter(c) || (c == '_' && isEscapeSequence(value,i)))
361            return true;
362      }
363      return false;
364   }
365
366   private static AsciiMap REPLACE_ATTR_VAL = new AsciiMap()
367      .append('&', "&amp;")
368      .append('<', "&lt;")
369      .append('>', "&gt;")
370      .append('"', "&quot;")
371      .append('\'', "&apos;")
372      .append((char)0x09, "&#x0009;")
373      .append((char)0x0A, "&#x000a;")
374      .append((char)0x0D, "&#x000d;");
375
376
377   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
378   // Decode XML text
379   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
380
381   /**
382    * Translates any _x####_ sequences (introduced by the various encode methods) back into their original characters.
383    *
384    * @param value The string being decoded.
385    * @param sb The string builder to use as a scratch pad.
386    * @return The decoded string.
387    */
388   public static final String decode(String value, StringBuilder sb) {
389      if (value == null)
390         return null;
391      if (value.length() == 0 || value.indexOf('_') == -1)
392         return value;
393      if (sb == null)
394         sb = new StringBuilder(value.length());
395
396      for (int i = 0; i < value.length(); i++) {
397         char c = value.charAt(i);
398         if (c == '_' && isEscapeSequence(value,i)) {
399
400            int x = Integer.parseInt(value.substring(i+2, i+6), 16);
401
402            // If we find _x0000_, then that means a null.
403            // If we find _xE000_, then that means an empty string.
404            if (x == 0)
405               return null;
406            else if (x != 0xE000)
407               sb.append((char)x);
408
409            i+=6;
410         } else {
411            sb.append(c);
412         }
413      }
414      return sb.toString();
415   }
416
417
418   /**
419    * Given a list of Strings and other Objects, combines Strings that are next to each other in the list.
420    *
421    * @param value The list of text nodes to collapse.
422    * @return The same list.
423    */
424   public static LinkedList<Object> collapseTextNodes(LinkedList<Object> value) {
425
426      String prev = null;
427      for (ListIterator<Object> i = value.listIterator(); i.hasNext();) {
428         Object o = i.next();
429         if (o instanceof String) {
430            if (prev == null)
431               prev = o.toString();
432            else {
433               prev += o;
434               i.remove();
435               i.previous();
436               i.remove();
437               i.add(prev);
438            }
439         } else {
440            prev = null;
441         }
442      }
443      return value;
444   }
445
446   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
447   // Other methods
448   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
449
450   // Returns true if the specified character can safely be used in XML text or an attribute.
451   private static final boolean isValidXmlCharacter(char c) {
452      return (c >= 0x20 && c <= 0xD7FF) /*|| c == 0xA || c == 0xD*/ || (c >= 0xE000 && c <= 0xFFFD);
453   }
454
455   // Returns true if the string at the specified position is of the form "_x####_"
456   // where '#' are hexadecimal characters.
457   private static final boolean isEscapeSequence(String s, int i) {
458      return s.length() > i+6
459         && s.charAt(i) == '_'
460         && s.charAt(i+1) == 'x'
461         && isHexCharacter(s.charAt(i+2))
462         && isHexCharacter(s.charAt(i+3))
463         && isHexCharacter(s.charAt(i+4))
464         && isHexCharacter(s.charAt(i+5))
465         && s.charAt(i+6) == '_';
466   }
467
468   // Returns true if the character is a hexadecimal character
469   private static final boolean isHexCharacter(char c) {
470      return (c >= '0' && c <= '9') || (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F');
471   }
472
473   // Converts an integer to a hexadecimal string padded to 4 places.
474   private static final Writer appendPaddedHexChar(Writer out, int num) throws IOException {
475      out.append("_x");
476      for (char c : toHex4(num))
477         out.append(c);
478      return out.append('_');
479   }
480
481   /**
482    * Find the namespace given a list of <ja>@Xml</ja> and <ja>@XmlSchema</ja> annotations.
483    *
484    * <p>
485    * The annotations should be a parent-to-child ordering of annotations found on a class or method.
486    *
487    * @param xmls The list of <ja>@Xml</ja> annotations.
488    * @param schemas The list of <ja>@XmlSchema</ja> annotations.
489    * @return The namespace, or <jk>null</jk> if it couldn't be found.
490    */
491   public static Namespace findNamespace(List<Xml> xmls, List<XmlSchema> schemas) {
492
493      for (int i = xmls.size()-1; i >= 0; i--) {
494         Xml xml = xmls.get(i);
495         Namespace ns = findNamespace(xml.prefix(), xml.namespace(), xmls, schemas);
496         if (ns != null)
497            return ns;
498      }
499
500      for (int i = schemas.size()-1; i >= 0; i--) {
501         XmlSchema schema = schemas.get(i);
502         Namespace ns = findNamespace(schema.prefix(), schema.namespace(), null, schemas);
503         if (ns != null)
504            return ns;
505      }
506
507      return null;
508   }
509
510   private static Namespace findNamespace(String prefix, String ns, List<Xml> xmls, List<XmlSchema> schemas) {
511
512      // If both prefix and namespace specified, use that Namespace mapping.
513      if (! (prefix.isEmpty() || ns.isEmpty()))
514         return Namespace.of(prefix, ns);
515
516      // If only prefix specified, need to search for namespaceURI.
517      if (! prefix.isEmpty()) {
518         if (xmls != null)
519            for (Xml xml2 : xmls)
520               if (xml2.prefix().equals(prefix) && ! xml2.namespace().isEmpty())
521                  return Namespace.of(prefix, xml2.namespace());
522         for (XmlSchema schema : schemas) {
523            if (schema.prefix().equals(prefix) && ! schema.namespace().isEmpty())
524               return Namespace.of(prefix, schema.namespace());
525            for (XmlNs xmlNs : schema.xmlNs())
526               if (xmlNs.prefix().equals(prefix))
527                  return Namespace.of(prefix, xmlNs.namespaceURI());
528         }
529         throw new BeanRuntimeException("Found @Xml.prefix annotation with no matching URI.  prefix='"+prefix+"'");
530      }
531
532      // If only namespaceURI specified, need to search for prefix.
533      if (! ns.isEmpty()) {
534         if (xmls != null)
535            for (Xml xml2 : xmls)
536               if (xml2.namespace().equals(ns) && ! xml2.prefix().isEmpty())
537                  return Namespace.of(xml2.prefix(), ns);
538         for (XmlSchema schema : schemas) {
539            if (schema.namespace().equals(ns) && ! schema.prefix().isEmpty())
540               return Namespace.of(schema.prefix(), ns);
541            for (XmlNs xmlNs : schema.xmlNs())
542               if (xmlNs.namespaceURI().equals(ns))
543                  return Namespace.of(xmlNs.prefix(), ns);
544         }
545      }
546
547      return null;
548   }
549
550   /**
551    * Utility method that converts the current event on the XML stream to something human-readable for debug purposes.
552    *
553    * @param r The XML stream reader whose current event is to be converted to a readable string.
554    * @return The event in human-readable form.
555    */
556   public static final String toReadableEvent(XMLStreamReader r) {
557      int t = r.getEventType();
558      if (t == 1)
559         return "<"+r.getLocalName()+">";
560      if (t == 2)
561         return "</"+r.getLocalName()+">";
562      if (t == 3)
563         return "PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION";
564      if (t == 4)
565         return "CHARACTERS=[" + r.getText() + "]";
566      if (t == 5)
567         return "COMMENTS=[" + r.getText() + "]";
568      if (t == 6)
569         return "SPACE=[" + r.getText() + "]";
570      if (t == 7)
571         return "START_DOCUMENT";
572      if (t == 8)
573         return "END_DOCUMENT";
574      if (t == 9)
575         return "ENTITY_REFERENCE";
576      if (t == 10)
577         return "ATTRIBUTE";
578      if (t == 11)
579         return "DTD";
580      if (t == 12)
581         return "CDATA=["+r.getText()+"]";
582      if (t == 13)
583         return "NAMESPACE";
584      if (t == 14)
585         return "NOTATION_DECLARATION";
586      if (t == 15)
587         return "ENTITY_DECLARATION";
588      return "UNKNOWN";
589   }
590}
